content.question: Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function with first derivative <math alttext="g prime of x, equals, the square root of x cubed, plus x, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math> for <math alttext="x greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>. If <math alttext="g of 2, equals negative 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="g of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
